snippet: A commission appointed by the governor after the death of Michael Brown is calling for sweeping changes on matters of policing, the courts, education, health care, housing and more.
abstract: Ferguson Commission, convened by Missouri governor to review social ills and revise policy for St Louis region after shooting of Michael Brown, releases report; deems racism is primary cause of problems and recommends overhaul of regional law enforcement, judiciary and education systems; some question whether actions will follow diagnosis.
lead_paragraph: A commission appointed by the governor after the death of Michael Brown is calling for sweeping changes on matters of policing, the courts, education, health care, housing and more.

headline.main: Panel Studying Racial Divide in Missouri Presents a Blunt Picture of Inequity
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Commission, Citing Region’s Racial Inequity, Urges Broad Changes
